messages: 3f039b16e005caff151e73d432d141e6 (21:32): hi i am unable to resolv hostname on my machine ..wht shld i do ?

3f039b16e005caff151e73d432d141e6 (21:33): unknown hostname
3f039b16e005caff151e73d432d141e6 (21:34): when i try to ping www.yahoo.com
8cdc63d75e2ec434d35824633edbf66b (21:34): a128: cat /etc/resolv.conf

8cdc63d75e2ec434d35824633edbf66b (21:35): are you able to ping the name server?
b985732ebe6223be61fc52567fe4899c (21:35): I hope it's not literally 'namesever' ;)
9195ddae0b0d38a9c2fd1e0381edbd48 (21:35): you shouldnt add it in htere
b985732ebe6223be61fc52567fe4899c (21:35): http://www.opendns.com/ is what I've been using for DNS lately
9195ddae0b0d38a9c2fd1e0381edbd48 (21:35): OSX uses lookupd
9195ddae0b0d38a9c2fd1e0381edbd48 (21:35): which takes its config from netinfo
9195ddae0b0d38a9c2fd1e0381edbd48 (21:36): so you should add it into the configuration pane in the GUI
b985732ebe6223be61fc52567fe4899c (21:36): RichardP_: adjusting the Network system prefs also updates /etc/resolv.conf, so it may be the other way around too
9195ddae0b0d38a9c2fd1e0381edbd48 (21:36): System Preferences -> network
3f039b16e005caff151e73d432d141e6 (21:36): will it wont if sufficient to add only in resolv,.conf
9195ddae0b0d38a9c2fd1e0381edbd48 (21:36): ddfreyne: no, it doenst
8cdc63d75e2ec434d35824633edbf66b (21:37): i was referring to /etc/resolve.conf just to be able to verify if you had the correct settings
b985732ebe6223be61fc52567fe4899c (21:37): RichardP_: So I assume it's only updated for single-user mode or other arcane stuff?
